creator: Tekij√§

used_app_storage_info_sub: Storage shows how much of the available space the app is using for saved locations. If it reaches 100%, you can no longer save additional locations
aqi_info_us: The US AQI (Air Quality Index) is a measurement used to communicate the level of air pollution. It ranges from 0 to 500, with higher values indicating worse air quality.
aqi_info_eu: The EU AQI (Air Quality Index) is a measurement used to communicate the level of air pollution in the European Union. It is divided into five levels, from 'Good' to 'Very Poor,' based on the concentration of key pollutants.
update_weather_data_sub: Automatically update the weather data if it's outdated when a location is clicked
delete_locations_support_sub: This action removes every saved location except your default location. Use this if your saved locations are not visible, are duplicating, or experiencing any other bugs
activity_suggestions_temp_1: ü•∂ Extreme cold: In temperatures below -40¬∞C (-40¬∞F), you need high-insulation gear. Wear a heavy-duty down parka with windproof outer layers, a balaclava, thermal base layers, thick wool socks, insulated boots, and a face mask. All exposed skin must be covered to avoid frostbite.
activity_suggestions_temp_2: ü•∂ Extreme cold: Layer with thermal base layers (top and bottom), a down or synthetic coat, thick wool socks, insulated boots, and a wool hat. Make sure to wear insulated gloves and a scarf to cover exposed skin.
activity_suggestions_temp_3: ü•∂ Very cold: A heavy-duty winter jacket is necessary. Wear thermal leggings, thick wool socks, and insulated boots. Insulated gloves and a wool hat will keep you warm. Layering is key in these frigid temperatures.
activity_suggestions_temp_4: üß• Very cold: Layer with a heavy winter coat, sweater, and long underwear. Thermal gloves, insulated boots, and a scarf are essential. A wool hat or beanie will provide extra warmth for your head.
activity_suggestions_temp_5: üß• Cold weather: Wear a thick winter coat or puffer jacket with a sweater underneath. Insulated gloves, wool socks, a scarf, and a hat are necessary for comfort in these temperatures.
activity_suggestions_temp_6: üß• Cold weather: A heavy jacket or coat is recommended. Pair with thermal gloves, a wool scarf, and thick socks. Opt for boots to keep your feet warm and dry.
activity_suggestions_temp_7: üß• Cool weather: Layer with a warm jacket or puffer coat. Consider wearing thermal socks and boots, as well as gloves for extra protection from the chill. A scarf will also add warmth around your neck.
activity_suggestions_temp_8: üß≥ Mild weather: A light jacket or sweater should suffice. Pair with jeans or trousers, and consider a hat to protect against mild wind or sun exposure.
activity_suggestions_temp_9: üß≥ Mild weather: Dress in layers with a light jacket or sweater. You can wear long sleeves, but consider switching to short sleeves if it feels warm. A scarf can help if the wind picks up.
activity_suggestions_temp_10: ‚òÄÔ∏è Warm weather: Opt for breathable fabrics like cotton or linen. A short-sleeve shirt, shorts, or a skirt will keep you comfortable. Don‚Äôt forget sunglasses and sunscreen to protect against UV rays.
activity_suggestions_temp_11: ‚òÄÔ∏è Hot weather: Wear lightweight, moisture-wicking clothing like cotton or linen. A wide-brimmed hat and sunglasses are essential to shield from the sun. Stay hydrated and wear sunscreen, especially if you‚Äôll be outside for long periods.
activity_suggestions_temp_12: ‚òÄÔ∏è Hot weather: Dress in lightweight, breathable clothing. Lightweight, loose-fitting shirts and shorts or skirts will help you stay cool. Don‚Äôt forget to hydrate regularly and apply sunscreen to avoid sunburn.
activity_suggestions_temp_13: ‚òÄÔ∏è Extremely hot: Wear loose-fitting, moisture-wicking fabrics to stay cool. Avoid dark colors as they absorb heat. A wide-brimmed hat, sunglasses, and plenty of sunscreen are crucial. Stay in shaded areas as much as possible and drink water constantly.
activity_suggestions_humidity_1: üí¶ High humidity: Wear moisture-wicking clothes and carry a towel to stay dry.
activity_suggestions_humidity_2: üíß Low humidity: Use a hydrating moisturizer to avoid dry skin.

activity_suggestions_airQualityDescripti: üëç Air quality is good today. It's safe to be outdoors and breathe easy. üåø Perfect day for a walk in the park, jogging, or other outdoor activities!
üëå The air is fresh, so it's a great time to enjoy outdoor activities like hiking or biking. Stay active and enjoy the clear skies!
‚òÄÔ∏è With great air quality, it's the perfect time to engage in outdoor sports or simply relax outside. Go for a jog or picnic!

üëå Air quality is moderate. It's okay for most people, but sensitive individuals (children, elderly, or those with respiratory conditions) might want to limit prolonged outdoor exposure. üå≥ Consider taking it easy if you have allergies or asthma.
üåø Air quality is acceptable for most people, but be cautious if you have respiratory issues. Opt for light outdoor activities like walking or stretching.
üå•Ô∏è It's a good day for outdoor activities if you're generally healthy. However, individuals with asthma or other respiratory concerns should limit time outdoors.

‚ö†Ô∏è Air quality is unhealthy for sensitive groups. Those with respiratory or heart conditions should avoid strenuous outdoor activities. üè† If possible, stay indoors or wear a mask if you're heading outside.
üö∂ Sensitive individuals should reduce outdoor exposure. It might be best to stay indoors or use a mask if you need to go outside. Consider limiting outdoor exercise.
üí® If you have a pre-existing health condition, avoid outdoor activities and stay indoors to minimize exposure. Make sure to wear a mask if you must go outside.

üö∑ Air quality is unhealthy. Limit outdoor exposure as much as possible. üèÉ‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è For outdoor workers or athletes, consider rescheduling activities or using an N95 mask. üö´ Avoid physical activities outdoors, especially for children and people with health concerns.
‚ö†Ô∏è Due to unhealthy air quality, it's recommended to stay indoors. Reschedule outdoor activities or use an N95 mask if you need to go outside.
üí® Limit outdoor exposure and take precautions if you must be outside. People with respiratory or heart conditions should stay indoors and avoid exertion.

üö® Hazardous air quality! It's best to stay indoors at all costs. üå´Ô∏èÔ∏è If you must go outside, make sure to wear a high-quality face mask and minimize outdoor exposure. üõë People with heart or lung conditions should remain indoors and take necessary precautions.

‚ò†Ô∏è The air quality is hazardous, so stay indoors to protect your health. If you need to leave, wear a high-quality mask and limit exposure. People with pre-existing conditions should avoid outdoor activities.

üö∑ Extremely hazardous air quality! Stay indoors to avoid serious health risks. If you must go out, wear a respirator mask and minimize time outdoors. People with respiratory issues should not leave the house.
